Marketing Made Simple A Step-by-Step Storybrand Guide for Any Business   
- La subrayado en la página 50-50 | Añadido el lunes, 26 de septiembre de 2022 23:23:51

Keep it simple. Companies often make the mistake of using inside language that is hard to understand and sounds awkward when saying it out loud. Make sure this section is something that is easy to repeat and very clear. Use your name in the solution. By including your company name in the solution, you are associating your brand with the problem you solve. Make sure your solution is connected to the problem you just stated. The one-liner has to be cohesive. Do not try to explain everything you do for your customer in this section. This is a short, clear description of what service you offer.

The Map is not the Territory
==========
The-Great-Mental-Models-Volume-1_-General-Thinking-Concepts (Inigo)
- La subrayado en la posición 421-422 | Añadido el lunes, 5 de diciembre de 2022 19:54:58

Just because maps and models are flawed is not an excuse to ignore them. Maps are useful to the extent they are explanatory and predictive.
==========
The-Great-Mental-Models-Volume-1_-General-Thinking-Concepts (Inigo)
- La subrayado en la posición 428-430 | Añadido el lunes, 5 de diciembre de 2022 19:55:29

map may have a structure similar or dissimilar to the structure of the territory. The London underground map is super useful to travelers. The train drivers don’t use it at all! Maps describe a territory in a useful way, but with a specific purpose. They cannot be everything to everyone.
==========
The-Great-Mental-Models-Volume-1_-General-Thinking-Concepts (Inigo)
- La subrayado en la posición 440-442 | Añadido el lunes, 5 de diciembre de 2022 19:56:02

But something is lost in the process. We can lose the specific and relevant details that were distilled into an abstraction. And, because we often consume these abstractions as gospel, without having done the hard mental work ourselves, it’s tricky to see when the map no longer agrees with the territory. We inadvertently forget that the map is not reality.
==========
The-Great-Mental-Models-Volume-1_-General-Thinking-Concepts (Inigo)
- La subrayado en la posición 446-447 | Añadido el lunes, 5 de diciembre de 2022 19:56:33

When we mistake the map for reality, we start to think we have all the answers. We create static rules or policies that deal with the map but forget that we exist in a constantly changing world.
==========

- La subrayado en la posición 484-485 | Añadido el lunes, 5 de diciembre de 2022 20:00:26

==========
The-Great-Mental-Models-Volume-1_-General-Thinking-Concepts (Inigo)
- La subrayado en la posición 592-594 | Añadido el lunes, 5 de diciembre de 2022 20:02:58

When ego and not competence drives what we undertake, we have blind spots. If you know what you understand, you know where you have an edge over others. When you are honest about where your knowledge is lacking you know where you are vulnerable and where you can improve. Understanding your circle of competence improves decision-making and outcomes.
==========

- La subrayado en la posición 612-613 | Añadido el lunes, 5 de diciembre de 2022 20:04:39

The difference between the detailed web of knowledge in the Lifer’s head and the surface knowledge in the Stranger’s head is the difference between being inside a circle of competence and being outside the perimeter. True knowledge of a complex territory cannot be faked.
==========

- La subrayado en la posición 663-664 | Añadido el lunes, 5 de diciembre de 2022 20:07:18

==========

Part of successfully using circles of competence includes knowing when we are outside them—when we are not well equipped to make decisions. ==========

- La subrayado en la posición 696-698 | Añadido el lunes, 5 de diciembre de 2022 20:09:25

The problem of incentives can really skew how much you can rely on someone else’s circle of competence. This is particularly acute in the financial realm. Until recently, nearly all financial products we might be pushed into had commissions attached to them—in other words, our advisor made more money by giving us one set of advice than another, regardless of its wisdom.
==========

First Principles Thinking
==========
The-Great-Mental-Models-Volume-1_-General-Thinking-Concepts (Inigo)
- La subrayado en la posición 841-841 | Añadido el lunes, 5 de diciembre de 2022 20:26:01

Socratic questioning and the Five Whys.
==========
The-Great-Mental-Models-Volume-1_-General-Thinking-Concepts (Inigo)
- La subrayado en la posición 844-844 | Añadido el lunes, 5 de diciembre de 2022 20:26:15

Socratic questioning generally follows this process:
==========
The-Great-Mental-Models-Volume-1_-General-Thinking-Concepts (Inigo)
- La subrayado en la posición 845-848 | Añadido el lunes, 5 de diciembre de 2022 20:26:24

Clarifying your thinking and explaining the origins of your ideas. (Why do I think this? What exactly do I think?) Challenging assumptions. (How do I know this is true? What if I thought the opposite?) Looking for evidence. (How can I back this up? What are the sources?)
==========
The-Great-Mental-Models-Volume-1_-General-Thinking-Concepts (Inigo)
- La subrayado en la posición 849-852 | Añadido el lunes, 5 de diciembre de 2022 20:27:05

Considering alternative perspectives. (What might others think? How do I know I am correct?) Examining consequences and implications. (What if I am wrong? What are the consequences if I am?) Questioning the original questions. (Why did I think that? Was I correct? What conclusions can I draw from the reasoning process?)
==========
The-Great-Mental-Models-Volume-1_-General-Thinking-Concepts (Inigo)
- La subrayado en la posición 853-854 | Añadido el lunes, 5 de diciembre de 2022 20:27:11

Socratic questioning stops you from relying on your gut and limits strong emotional responses. This process helps you build something that lasts.
==========
The-Great-Mental-Models-Volume-1_-General-Thinking-Concepts (Inigo)
- La subrayado en la posición 843-844 | Añadido el lunes, 5 de diciembre de 2022 20:27:28

and ordinary discussions is that the former seeks to draw out first principles in a systematic
==========
The-Great-Mental-Models-Volume-1_-General-Thinking-Concepts (Inigo)
- La subrayado en la posición 857-857 | Añadido el lunes, 5 de diciembre de 2022 20:28:33

The goal of the Five Whys is to land on a “what” or “how”.
==========
The-Great-Mental-Models-Volume-1_-General-Thinking-Concepts (Inigo)
- La subrayado en la posición 859-860 | Añadido el lunes, 5 de diciembre de 2022 20:28:52

If your “whys” result in a statement of falsifiable fact, you have hit a first principle. If they end up with a “because I said so” or ”it just is”, you know you have landed on an assumption that may be based on popular opinion, cultural myth, or dogma. These are not first principles.
==========
The-Great-Mental-Models-Volume-1_-General-Thinking-Concepts (Inigo)
- La subrayado en la posición 912-914 | Añadido el lunes, 5 de diciembre de 2022 20:34:55

Starting in the 1970s, scientists began to ask: what are the first principles of meat? The answers generally include taste, texture, smell, and use in cooking. Do you know what is not a first principle of meat? Once being a part of an animal. Perhaps most important to consumers is the taste. Less important is whether it was actually once part of a cow.
==========
The-Great-Mental-Models-Volume-1_-General-Thinking-Concepts (Inigo)
- La subrayado en la posición 939-940 | Añadido el lunes, 5 de diciembre de 2022 20:39:43

Thought Experiment
==========
The-Great-Mental-Models-Volume-1_-General-Thinking-Concepts (Inigo)
- La subrayado en la posición 962-966 | Añadido el lunes, 5 de diciembre de 2022 20:47:48

Much like the scientific method, a thought experiment generally has the following steps: Ask a question Conduct background research Construct hypothesis Test with (thought) experiments
==========
The-Great-Mental-Models-Volume-1_-General-Thinking-Concepts (Inigo)
- La subrayado en la posición 1062-1063 | Añadido el lunes, 5 de diciembre de 2022 20:53:13

Intuiting the non-intuitive: One of the uses of thought experiments is to improve our ability to intuit the non-intuitive.
==========
The-Great-Mental-Models-Volume-1_-General-Thinking-Concepts (Inigo)
- La subrayado en la posición 1082-1086 | Añadido el lunes, 5 de diciembre de 2022 20:54:54

Theory of Justice. In order to figure out the most fair and equitable way to structure society, he proposed that the designers of said society operate behind a veil of ignorance. This means that they could not know who they would be in the society they were creating. If they designed the society without knowing their economic status, their ethnic background, talents and interests, or even their gender, they would have to put in place a structure that was as fair as possible in order to guarantee the best possible outcome for themselves. 
==========
The-Great-Mental-Models-Volume-1_-General-Thinking-Concepts (Inigo)
- La subrayado en la posición 1124-1124 | Añadido el lunes, 5 de diciembre de 2022 20:56:19

Second-Order Thinking
==========
The-Great-Mental-Models-Volume-1_-General-Thinking-Concepts (Inigo)
- La subrayado en la posición 1126-1128 | Añadido el lunes, 5 de diciembre de 2022 20:56:32

Second-order thinking is thinking farther ahead and thinking holistically. It requires us to not only consider our actions and their immediate consequences, but the subsequent effects of those actions as well.
==========
The-Great-Mental-Models-Volume-1_-General-Thinking-Concepts (Inigo)
- La subrayado en la posición 1173-1175 | Añadido el martes, 6 de diciembre de 2022 20:59:05

Warren Buffett used a very apt metaphor once to describe how the second-order problem is best described by a crowd at a parade: Once a few people decide to stand on their tip-toes, everyone has to stand on their tip-toes. No one can see any better, but they’re all worse off.
==========
The-Great-Mental-Models-Volume-1_-General-Thinking-Concepts (Inigo)
- La subrayado en la posición 1274-1275 | Añadido el martes, 6 de diciembre de 2022 21:01:24

Probabilistic thinking is essentially trying to estimate, using some tools of math and logic, the likelihood of any specific outcome coming to pass.
==========
The-Great-Mental-Models-Volume-1_-General-Thinking-Concepts (Inigo)
- La subrayado en la posición 1301-1302 | Añadido el martes, 6 de diciembre de 2022 21:02:07

Bayesian thinking allows us to use all relevant prior information in making decisions. Statisticians might call it a base rate, taking in outside information about past situations like the one you’re in.
==========
The-Great-Mental-Models-Volume-1_-General-Thinking-Concepts (Inigo)
- La subrayado en la posición 1520-1521 | Añadido el martes, 6 de diciembre de 2022 21:11:10

Inversion is a powerful tool to improve your thinking because it helps you identify and remove obstacles to success.
==========
The-Great-Mental-Models-Volume-1_-General-Thinking-Concepts (Inigo)
- La subrayado en la posición 1523-1524 | Añadido el martes, 6 de diciembre de 2022 21:11:25

Inversion allows us to flip the problem around and think backward. Sometimes it’s good to start at the beginning, but it can be more useful to start at the end.
==========
The-Great-Mental-Models-Volume-1_-General-Thinking-Concepts (Inigo)
- La subrayado en la posición 1527-1530 | Añadido el martes, 6 de diciembre de 2022 21:11:45

Start by assuming that what you’re trying to prove is either true or false, then show what else would have to be true. Instead of aiming directly for your goal, think deeply about what you want to avoid and then see what options are left over. Set your assumptions:
==========
The-Great-Mental-Models-Volume-1_-General-Thinking-Concepts (Inigo)
- La subrayado en la posición 1679-1680 | Añadido el martes, 6 de diciembre de 2022 21:18:52

Simpler explanations are more likely to be true than complicated ones. This is the essence of Occam’s Razor, a classic principle of logic and problem-solving.
==========
The-Great-Mental-Models-Volume-1_-General-Thinking-Concepts (Inigo)
- La subrayado en la posición 1819-1820 | Añadido el martes, 6 de diciembre de 2022 21:51:05

Hard to trace in its origin, Hanlon’s Razor states that we should not attribute to malice that which is more easily explained by stupidity. In a complex world, using this model helps us avoid paranoia and ideology.
==========

A Two would get antsy at the thought of all the processes that might be improved, people who might be held accountable to achieving the standard, or sales calls that could be made while he was wasting time just thinking about strategy.

E sta mañana recuerda qué controlas y qué no. Recuerda enfocarte en lo primero, no en lo segundo. Antes de comer, recuerda que lo único que posees es tu capacidad para tomar decisiones (para emplear la razón y el juicio al hacerlo). Es lo único que nunca te pueden quitar del todo. Por la tarde, recuerda que además de las decisiones que tomas, tu destino no depende de ti por completo.

- La subrayado en la página 130 | posición 1758-1761 | Añadido el lunes, 5 de febrero de 2024 23:15:30

There is always some inefficiency. So species rarely evolve to become perfect at anything, because perfecting one skill comes at the expense of another skill that will eventually be critical to survival. The lion could be bigger and catch more prey; the tree could be taller and get more sun. But they’re not, because it would backfire.
==========

Last is the power of stories over statistics.

Same_as_Ever_A_Guide_to_What_Never_Changes (Morgan Housel)
- La subrayado en la página 77 | posición 1100-1102 | Añadido el domingo, 11 de febrero de 2024 11:35:04

“Housing prices in relation to median incomes are now above their historic average and typically mean revert” is a statistic. “Jim just made $500,000 flipping homes and can now retire early and his wife thinks he’s amazing” is a story. And it’s way more persuasive in the moment.
==========
Same_as_Ever_A_Guide_to_What_Never_Changes (Morgan Housel)
- La subrayado en la página 78 | posición 1108-1116 | Añadido el domingo, 11 de febrero de 2024 11:36:07

There is a very common life cycle of greed and fear. It goes like this: First you assume good news is permanent. Then you become oblivious to bad news. Then you ignore bad news. Then you deny bad news. Then you panic at bad news. Then you accept bad news. Then you assume bad news is permanent. Then you become oblivious to good news.
==========
Same_as_Ever_A_Guide_to_What_Never_Changes (Morgan Housel)
- La subrayado en la página 80 | posición 1129-1133 | Añadido el domingo, 11 de febrero de 2024 11:36:54

When an economy is stable, people get optimistic. • When people get optimistic, they go into debt. • When they go into debt, the economy becomes unstable. Minsky’s big idea was that stability is destabilizing.
==========
Same_as_Ever_A_Guide_to_What_Never_Changes (Morgan Housel)
- La subrayado en la página 80 | posición 1133-1134 | Añadido el domingo, 11 de febrero de 2024 11:37:03

A lack of recessions actually plants the seeds of the next recession, which is why we can never get rid of them.
==========

mosquetes pesan unos diez kilos, por lo que es necesario emplear una horquilla para apoyarlos en el suelo antes de disparar. A continuación abren fuego los arcabuces, desde una distancia menor. - La subrayado en la página 21 | posición 285-287 | Añadido el jueves, 1 de agosto de 2024 19:56:26

- La subrayado en la página 23 | posición 316-317 | Añadido el jueves, 1 de agosto de 2024 19:58:38

The_Learning_Game (Ana Lorena Fábrega)
- La subrayado en la página 24 | posición 320-322 | Añadido el jueves, 1 de agosto de 2024 19:58:53

- La subrayado en la página 22 | posición 221-224 | Añadido el viernes, 9 de agosto de 2024 18:57:50

Ivan came to power in 1533. It encroached east on the Urals, south to the Caspian Sea and north towards the Arctic Circle. It gained access to the Caspian, and later the Black Sea, thus taking advantage of the Caucasus Mountains as a partial barrier between it and the Mongols. A military base was built in Chechnya to deter any would-be attackers, be they the Mongol Golden Hordes, the Ottoman Empire or the Persians.
==========

The massive boom in shale gas production in the USA is not only enabling it to be self-sufficient in energy, but also to sell its surplus to one of the great energy consumers – Europe. the-great-mental-models-volume-2-physics-chemistry-and-biology-1999449037-9781999449032 (Inigo)
- La subrayado en la posición 181-183 | Añadido el sábado, 24 de agosto de 2024 18:09:01

She was sitting at the midpoint of the train. If the train had been stationary, she would have observed the two lightning strikes being simultaneous like you did. However, because the train was moving, the light from the rear strike had farther to travel to reach her. She perceived the light from the strike at the front first.
==========

Six Easy Pieces: Essentials of Physics Explained by Its Most Brilliant Teacher \( PDFDrive.com \).mobi (Richard P. Feynman)
- La subrayado en la posición 416-417 | Añadido el sábado, 24 de agosto de 2024 18:18:18

all things are made of atoms—little particles that move around in perpetual motion, attracting each other when they are a little distance apart, but repelling upon being squeezed into one another.
==========
Six Easy Pieces: Essentials of Physics Explained by Its Most Brilliant Teacher \( PDFDrive.com \).mobi (Richard P. Feynman)
- La subrayado en la posición 437-438 | Añadido el sábado, 24 de agosto de 2024 18:20:48

Now 10-8 cm is called an angstrom (just as another name), so we say they are 1 or 2 angstroms (Å) in radius. Another way to remember their size is
==========
Six Easy Pieces: Essentials of Physics Explained by Its Most Brilliant Teacher \( PDFDrive.com \).mobi (Richard P. Feynman)
- La subrayado en la posición 436-439 | Añadido el sábado, 24 de agosto de 2024 18:20:59

The atoms are 1 or 2 × 10-8 cm in radius. Now 10-8 cm is called an angstrom (just as another name), so we say they are 1 or 2 angstroms (Å) in radius. Another way to remember their size is this: if an apple is magnified to the size of the earth, then the atoms in the apple are approximately the size of the original apple.
==========
Six Easy Pieces: Essentials of Physics Explained by Its Most Brilliant Teacher \( PDFDrive.com \).mobi (Richard P. Feynman)
- La subrayado en la posición 442-445 | Añadido el sábado, 24 de agosto de 2024 18:22:08

molecular attraction. Now the jiggling motion is what we represent as heat: when we increase the temperature, we increase the motion. If we heat the water, the jiggling increases and the volume between the atoms increases, and if the heating continues there comes a time when the pull between the molecules is not enough to hold them together and they do fly apart and become separated from one another. Of course, this is how we manufacture steam out of water—by
==========

This means that when we compress a gas slowly, the temperature of the gas increases. So, under slow compression, a gas will increase in temperature, and under slow expansion it will decrease in temperature.

- La subrayado en la página 29 | posición 308-310 | Añadido el domingo, 8 de septiembre de 2024 23:02:41

En el amor auténtico no se espera nada del otro; en el romántico, sí. Todavía más: el amor romántico es, esencialmente, la esperanza de que nuestra pareja nos dé la felicidad. Sobrecargamos al otro con nuestras expectativas cuando nos enamoramos. Y tales son las expectativas que cargamos sobre el ser amado que, al final, de él, o de ella, no queda ya prácticamente nada.
==========

Historia_de_Roma_contada_para_escepticos_Juan_Eslava_Galan (Juan Eslava Galán)
- La subrayado en la posición 1347-1349 | Añadido el miércoles, 11 de diciembre de 2024 19:37:17

El garum se elabora en la costa meridional de Hispania a partir de entrañas de atunes, murenas, caballas, esturiones… fermentadas al sol durante meses en albercas de salmuera. Cuando aquella apestosa podredumbre se ha reducido a la mitad por efecto de la evaporación, la prensan y obtienen un líquido oscuro: el precioso garum.

Mental time travel is a neat trick for self-reflection. In its simplest form, it involves separating from one’s present self and entering a past or future version of the self. It’s a useful tool for creating gratitude—imagine how amazed your younger self would be at what you’ve accomplished. And it gives you perspective—imagine how much your older self would long to be where you are today.

How are they supposed to know what a hardworking dad looks like if they never actually get to see it? How are they supposed to learn what work looks like at all? That is also your job. To be the example. There is an old Latin expression: A bove maiori discit arare minor. “The younger ox learns to plow from the elder.” That’s because the oxen would be harnessed together. Not only would the kid get to see their mom or dad do what they did, but they’d be literally strapped into it together, to learn on the job.

In 1940, a child born into an American household had a 92 percent chance of making more money than her parents. But a child born in the 1980s has just a 50 percent chance of surpassing their parents’ income.23 In forty years, the American dream went from being a widespread reality to a coin toss.
==========

- La subrayado en la página 45 | posición 723-726 | Añadido el martes, 26 de agosto de 2025 12:49:55

manage those risks, you need to control what happens around your home. You do that through zoning and organizing. You do it through restricting how many homes and what kinds of homes can be built near you. You do it by making the minimum allowable lot sizes bigger and the parking requirements more expansive because both those rules ensure that only wealthier people will be able to buy into your community.
==========
